dialog: Are you part of the organisation?
We just pick up and deliver.
Yeah. Pizza, Chinese food, any food.
Are you connected with the CIA?
We don't know nothin' about the CIA.
Where do we go from here?
You're goin' to a duck farm. We're goin' to party.
A pile of greens couldn't get me past 50.
âª You belong to my heart...
OK, folks, the party's over. Let's go.
You gotta go to bed. You want me to wake you up?
Well, you wind up with the paper.
Come on, sweet thing. Come on, try something that'll help ya.
Let's go. Five o'clock. Let's go.
They screwed us out of 20 minutes yesterday. Better get goin'.
I gotta shower and shave, man.
âª Ridin' on that blue river train âª Ridin' on that blue river train âª Ridin' on that blue river, ridin' on that blue river, ridin' on that blue river train Give me $100.
What can you do with this stuff? It's monopoly money.
What do you think of that chick you left in bed?
You're up tonight. She thinks we're a couple of fags cos we split the rent.
I'm nosy. I was snoopin' in her purse, and I came across this important document.
That's why girls don't go for you.
You're always doin' stuff like that.

"Dear Miss Summers, your Pap test returned and is negative, but you do show conclusive evidence of vaginal infection." "Please call for an appointment to see me as soon as possible." "Respectfully yours, Dr. L. Wolfberg." Oh, God.
Dirty guy! What does "vaginal infection" mean? That don't have to mean nothin'.
"Vaginal infection" means she's got a disease. A disease of the...
What's a purple grackle go like?
Give me the Maryland state bird, man.
Why didn't you stop me, man? Why didn't you stop me?
You know, I think you deserve a round of applause.
âª Ramona, I hear the mission bells acalling âª Ramona...
Sing it out! I said sing it out!
Not like you, you dirty rat bastard.
Why'd you leave me with her all night without tellin' me?
I know you don't have any prejudice, and besides, I didn't wanna disturb you.
OK, one at a time. Come in.
Now you guys are damn near 40.
We watched some horny ducks on the late infrared show. Ever see a duck make it?
I don't wanna talk about it.
I don't wanna talk about it.
See you tomorrow at three o'clock sharp.
And how are you, Mr. Vorodny?
I was supposed to have been taken out by Wednesday.
That was part of my agreement.
We know nothin'. We're hired to protect the goods, and you're good to somebody.
Think of us that way and you'll stay alive and be a lot happier, huh?
I've been told you have never lost one of us yet.
Look, I was only kidding, grouch.
I had 50 of these printed up.
All I have to do is fill in the blank.
What? You mean that's not for real?
No, we've passed 'em all over North Beach. Oh, my God...
You think that's funny? Think it's funny?
I thought it was pretty funny.
I've requested a town in Oregon.
One more foreigner in a small town somewhere, with a pension.
I've asked for a town where I can raise hops.
Without hops we have no beer.
I will call myself Thomas Mix.
Do you like the name Mr. Mix?
You're a ward of the CIA, Brewmeister Mix. Ask them.
You all look alike, you young mercenaries. No matter what country.
We're all idealists. You think we do it for the money?
what it's like to live in a closed society.
You can't wait out here. We'll page you as soon as we know anything.
OK, I'm gonna go over and check the instruments.
Better get gloves on. I wanna check the wound. You got the draw sheet?
OK, gurney out of the room.
I'll check the elbow. Check his knee.
Let's have a double prep, a Betadine prep and double draping.
Can we have irrigation now, please?
Do you want me closer or further?
I will be waking him up shortly. Soon as we get the cast on, you can wake him up.
Finish it and we'll transfer him over.
Slit the shorts. Could you cut 'em open?
See if you can lift him up.
Slowly and gently on three. You ready?
All right, let's get ready to transfer.
It's time to take your vital signs. You're in ICU.
I'm gonna take your blood pressure.
That's all right by me, honey.
Care for a little more ham?
Didn't hurt you there, did I?
Slip this... Put this on my ear.
You wanna hear, you gotta stick it in your ear.
You gotta stick it in your...
You gotta stick it in your ear.
I don't hear nothin'. It's all over.
âª Oh, say can you see All right, all right. Let's see if you're still alive.
You gonna take that garbage outta here?
No more of this garbage. OK.
We'll be seein' a lot of each other.
Oh. Well, I'll just be hangin' around.
Well... I asked them to hang me out there on that clothes line.
Thought I'd dry out faster, you know.
They're givin' me some goodfeelin' stuff, I'll tell you that.
I'm learnin' all about that anatomy, like, um, femurs, patellas, fibulas. All that good stuff.
I talk to them at night, you know.
I'm savin' the first spot for my roomie, but he hasn't come by to sign as yet.
We turned over every rock. Nothing.
Whoever made him a better offer is keeping him off the market.
Can't figure out why he didn't put that third one in my head.
It's in the plus column. Normal gradefive disability's 1,000 a month.
Mr. Weyburn thinks he can get you 1500.
But in the meantime be thankful you work for a private company and we turn a profit.
If you were still with the government, you'd be getting 200. And the GI bill.
I'm your numberone boy, Mr. Weyburn. Numero uno.
I got that in writing from you, along with a very nice Christmas bonus. Remember?
That's what he wanted me to be.
I checked with the staff doctors, Mike. I also called a friend who is considered to be one of the best orthopaedic surgeons in the world.
He says, given a year, maybe you'll be able to walk up a flight of stairs.
That leg of yours will never be...
Thank you very much for cheering me up. And thanks for the flowers.
We'll stop in from time to time.
Anything particular we can send you?
Some hash and a couple of broads.
You guys got connections, don't you?
Under the circumstances, that seems appropriate.
You may feel as the stitches come out.
I hate a guy that's always right.
I don't know how good a knee you're gonna have, but the scar is beautiful.
This is gonna hurt a little bit.
Agh! Hold it, hold it, hold it. Wait.
There's somethin' grabbin' me on the elbow.
You all right? It's all over.
Mm, that's a beautiful one too.
I don't feel that. How come?
Well, you probably severed some nerve for the skin. But that'll grow back.
I hope not. I like not feelin' it.
Now, let's try some leg raisings.
I'll let it... Try to lower it yourself.
Well, now, how are we doin'?
Forgot about my good right one!
All right. That's enough for one day.
Have you got some place else to go?
OK, Amy, lift his leg up.
You may feel a little discomfort as it goes over the knee.
OK. We're gonna hook a boot onto this.
Let me see. I'll check your arm.
Good. OK. Tighten up the Velcro.
OK, you got 5, Let's see that one.
I thought I'd just stop up.
Well, don't. Go on, get outta here.
Thanks. I'll take it. Thank you.
Don't worry about it. Always wanted to take a bath in champagne.
It's all right. Thank you. It's all right. All right.

âª First you put your left leg close up tight âª Then you move your right crutch further to the right âª Bring your legs together nice and tight âª Then you do it, you do it through the night âª Then you take your...
âª Your, uh, crutches without despair âª You take 'em in your hands  âª You throw 'em in the air  What are you doin'?
âª And that's what I call up your bird Looks like you're ready. Well, all right.
Can you make it all right?
Hey, come on, Mike, take it easy. You're tryin' too hard.
Hey, man, thought you were in a wheelchair.
Would you like to have a little...? What's your usual...?
Weyburn and the others, what the hell do they know?
They think you're becoming a ridiculous spectacle, driving yourself like this.
Just to show you how screwed up the world is becoming, would you believe that heroism has become oldfashioned?
All the traitors, the terrorists  they're gonna get the sympathy now.
That's how Hansen made his move up.
The Hansens of the world are in.
And the, um, cleft chins and true hearts are out.
Weyburn will never put you back in harness. No way, Mike.
And, uh, if you don't mind, don't drop round the shop, huh?
And it makes the boys nervous  you know, clumpclumping around.
Doesn't fit in with the Muzak.
If a guy can't blow up his best friend, where's the morality in the world, Cap?
You'll limp the rest of your life.
When you get that straight in your head, I want you to come to my office...
and I'll give you a decent, dignified job. How about it, huh?
I just wanna get closer to George.
So you find him and you zap him.
Will that give you back your knee and your elbow?
But wherever they are, I know they'll be a lot happier.
I'll just limp on outta here.
I'm sorry, man. I caught you with the metal. You all right?
I won't be playin' violin again. Put that mother back where you were pointin' her.
See, man, that's not right. All I have to do is...
If you hit a guy there, he's not gonna lose any sleep.
But... usin' the same block you made, pivot toward me.
Bring your hip toward me. Right.
Right. Bring your elbow to my temple.
You'll spill my brains. Let's try it.
Western Airlines flight 419 from Mexico City now arriving gate 39.
ComTeg tape library. Hold on a second, please. Mr. Collie?
Your friend O'Leary's in the office. Come on up.
O'Leary? What does the son of a bitch want now?
I'll be back in a few minutes.
Their longevity lies within the context of your communication.
Oh, I know, I know, I know.
I even recite the love sonnets of Elizabeth Barrett Browning to the poor thing.
Did you ever consider, my dear Cap, how much energy you've wasted over your 47 years mustering up that goodfellow smile?
What corner has he painted us into now?
The CIA gives us 11 per cent of our gross.
Give me ten minutes of your time. Surely 11 per cent of your gross will buy me that.
Hansen sold out. Killed one of our most important clients.
And shot up our top man.
You still think we were behind that?
Would you like it book, chapter and verse? Or just the morning paper?
So what have you got for us now?
It'll be in the papers by now.
They didn't quite match the massacre at Tokyo airport, but they gave it a nice try.
Yuen Chung, the clear target of a rather substantive assassin group, defended himself with his usual skill.
Chung. I thought somebody had taken care of him.
But it's not in the national interest that it should happen either today or tomorrow.
It's central that it doesn't happen under any circumstances in the United States.
What happens to him Friday, after he's gone...
We're not sure, except it's something off the FarEast circuit.
We've had word that Negato Toku may be in the country.
But he's never been outside Japan.
If he is here, it's either for compelling personal reasons, or he's being paid a lot of yen. The point is, we do know that Yuen Chung is here.
We've got to keep him alive until he connects with a ship.
The position of our agency is, for once, manifestly clear.
We don't wish to, and will not, become involved any further than we already are.
We don't want Yuen Chung killed in the United States.
Right now we can't afford the publicity.
You still haven't given us a reason why we should take this on.
We've had word that after the chop suey at the airport this morning...
the Japanese assassin group have been augmented by a backup team.
San Francisco's a beautiful place. Try to adjust.
Hold it. Hold it. You're not authorised.
Officer? Will you look at this?
Wait a minute. Wait a minute! What's goin' on here?
May I see your identification, please?
I want a firstrate team on the job before dark.
Where do they pick up on your boy?
When you have the team assembled... call my office.
Let him pick his own team.
In fact, give him the complete responsibility.
Uh, win a few, lose a few.
We'll take care of it. I'll pay a buck to the first guy that gets my cane back.
What happens when your opponent is  I guess I'd just shoot him with mine.
Probably the same place you got yours, you jackass.
Uh, Donnie, I'll call you guys later, huh? Thanks a lot.
Would you excuse us for a minute?
All you gotta do is keep him alive until we can get him out on the ship.
First you'll need a driver and a backup.
You're up against a team of international assassins. You need a lot of fire power.
On top of that, the San Francisco Police Department is looking for your man.
He left some debris at the airport this morning.
Well, I guess I'll get Mac and Miller.
One's retired and the other one's crazy. ComTeg won't stand for it.
OK. How much time have I got?
And when does East meet West?
Our contractee will let us know.
You call me when you're set. Two minutes to five.
Is there a bullish market on Asian politicians?
Oh, there's someone on the visitors' team we'd like you to tag for us.
Waiting for a shipment. Brandnew AK47s. Best combat rifle in the world.
Got a buyer, but the guns are running late.
Well, I got somethin' a little better than clay pigeons for you.
I don't think your company'd hire me. They got me tapped as a psycho.
Well, they just don't understand you, Miller.
You're not a psycho. You're, um...
You're the patron poet of the manic depressives.
I don't think anybody can handle three days of what we got.
Well, I need a little vacation.
Besides, you always did enchant me.
Well, hell, we'll just pick out some furniture and get goin'.
Meet you at Mac's garage, 1874 Fuller.
You look OK for a robot.
I owe it all to 3InOne Oil.
You know, I come to the hospital, and then I still wrote you.
Your right arm doesn't work either, huh?
Well, you know how hard it is for me to write, Mac.
Look, uh, you got a couple days you can give me?
What are you up to, Mike?
I thought you were outta that for good.
Well, it's a chance to get Hansen.
I already took the job, and, uh, I need you. Unless you want him to get me.
They're not for you, they're for her. Here.
I need somethin' heavy, somethin' fast. You know, somethin' that'll blend in.
I'll go put these in water.
Remember him? Sam from the company.
Well, it blends in, all right. What else has it got that makes it so charming?
Gas tank is tucked under the rear seat.
How come we never used this before?
I just got it, Mike. Some union guy put it all together.
Bulletproof glass. And then they shot him in bed. I got it from his widow.
I... thought you kissed the business off. Why'd you buy a buggy like this?
You know, uh, maybe I appreciate a good machine.
I used to think what I did was nice and necessary, you know?
What the hell do I know?
Who's the clown behind the tool rack?
Oh, that's Miller. He's with us.
Josephine was robbed a couple of times last month. I'm sorry.
I got somethin' better if you want it.
Old weapon. Slow rate of fire.
Oh, hey. I got time to change?
No, we'll clean up later. Come on.
You have to sign this. Right here. It won't go out if you don't.
Can I have a clean shirt? I'm goin' away for a couple of days.
LI thought you said you were gonna give up that profession for good.
I'm gonna be gone a couple of days. If anybody calls.
I'm sorry, Josephine. You know how it is, don't you?
No, no. I mean she called me Mr. Davis.
When you're around she calls everybody Mr. Davis. Just like the old days.
I know a lot about you, you know that?
Don't hurt anybody just for fun, OK?
How would you like me to take that .45 and shove it where it belongs, cabbie?
All right, here's where you go.
Left to Sacramento, right on Grant.
You plannin' to work in close?
I'll be with you on the perimeter, Jerome.
I don't know what I'd do without you.
Hey, don't stick that muzzle up in the air like that, man. The whole world'll see us.
Does his crowd have this yet?
I'll have to hand him the Xerox.
this is gonna make for too much clutter.
I told Mr. Collie that I strongly object to his bringing you into this.
My group, the ninja, work much more quietly.
That thing they tried at the airport this morning was a threering flop.
Your people may be black belts, but if they get in my way they'll end up blackandblue or DOA. That's a promise.
It's a matter of indifference to me who eliminates Yuen Chung.

However, Mr. Collie, simply as a matter of racial pride, if my group, the ninja, handle this matter and become personally involved, and if your man fails, you and I will have to renegotiate our arrangement.
And I don't believe for a second that you'll lose out either way.
In fact, you probably sent for this... this group.
That's your style, Cap. Setting people against each other.
have you visited your Swiss francs lately?
Your deposits have arrived on time.
We're gonna take him out this way.
Let's go, Mac. Take me around front.
Jerome, you watch those ledges over there.
Our buddy likes those down angles. It's his favourite lick.
Love to watch gravity at work.
Our client is obviously not a pro.
Anybody can fire into those windows from across the street on the roof.
Rifle, grenade. We'd better take him to the country, where we can lay a control zone.
Do you know a place we can stow him?
Georgie and I did some aerialphotography work on this place, along with a lot of footwork, a long time ago.
Keep that thing down if you can. You know what I mean?
Hand me my case, will ya?
All right. Now, look, you cover me to the door, man.
And you keep your eye out for any police cars, right?
Here. Take this. Let me know what's happening.
I'll bring my man out the back as soon as I can. Cover me.
I was told to ask for a Mr. Yi.
I'm the one you're asking for.
Hold it. Hold it. Let's keep it clean and simple. No subtitles, please.
Any attack in force would finish us.
Hold it. Hold it. You know Locken? Locken. I'm with Locken.
A garbage truck is blockin' the alley.
So... there ain't no garbage cans on the street.
George is up on the roof by the billboard.
He's got someone else with him too.
Are you gonna be surprised when you see my gun permit.
No, I can't do that. This has got a hair trigger.
If I throw it over there, there's a lot of people gonna get hurt.
Don't pull down on a cop.
You just made me an accessory.
A garbage truck is blockin' the alley.
I know. I wish Miller were in it.
What do you mean, he's no cop?
Tell me that's not a 9mm Star and I'll kiss your ass.
Just from that, you knew that?
San Francisco Police Department packs regulation Smith and Wesson .38s.
Pull her in tight, she likes to buck. I'll go for the tool kit.
It may be better to wait until the police come.
I don't care what you want. You wanna stay alive, get in that cab. Move it!
You want me to leave you?
I thought I told you to get outta here!
Get me outta here! Get me across the street. I wanna get George.
Are you here to help us?
Get us past that truck. Come on!
Stick your foot on it, Mac.
Are you Stirling Moss? Get outta here!
I'd say the first round was Locken's.
I misjudged him. His anticipation was better than mine.
There's a credo with the company I forgot to remember. Operate on the 6P principle.
Hey, don't be hard on yourself. I had a clear line on him. Missed.
Getting inside his defence work, that's the problem.
Where do you think he'll go?
Step on it a little, Mac.
Come on. I thought you had something in this machine. Do it!
What are you slowin' down for?
There's a rattle in the back.
Come on. Come on. Hurry up.
What? What are you talkin' about?
Hi. Need a tow or somethin'?
Drive shaft. I think I got it, thank you.
Want me to call Auto Club?
I'll have it fixed before they get here.
Patrol unit one. Patrol unit one. Your location, please.
What have you got in that bag?
No, no, no. Something that's not lethal.
Y'all step out of the car, where I can see you.
Easy! Don't shake the car, goddammit!
You, underneath, get your hands where I can see 'em.
Look, uh, I'd like to show you some ID.
Yeah. I'd like to see everybody's ID.
Now. Get your ass outta there before I drag you out by your heels.
Uh, no. Hey, this bomb'll go off. Please.
What the hell you want me to do with it?
That's not a bomb. It's an old piece of muffler.
It looks like it's set to go off two minutes from now.
What do you plan on doin' with that thing, Officer?
I'm gonna throw it as far away as I can.
Whoa. I wouldn't. That'd kill everybody.
And it's got a maximum range of 100 yards.
Well, wwwhat shall I do with it?
Well, uh, see that bay right there? I'd run down there and chuck it in there.
Christ! Now what are you gonna do?
Well, he's just gonna have to do things my way.
I'm gonna take your ketch to the old pier over at Bethlehem Steel.
We're pullin' out at eight o'clock. We'll deliver at three. Will the ship be waitin'?
I'll have it standing by. In the meantime I'll arrange for the transfer. Yeah.
Put the phone down, Cap. No more calls.
But I just wanted to, uh...
Excuse me, I just want to go to the bathroom.
It's in your imagination. I expect you to get Chung out to sea tomorrow.
I consider it nothing more than a routine matter.
Which department? Don't answer the phone. Thank you.
It's not my problem. They're in the hotel business anyway.
What about plastics? Anything in there about condoms?
I saw that just a moment ago.
Distribution. Make a note of it.
This I don't believe. The stock's up. They don't even have a company.
No, no. I'm not going to.
Well... it's getting late and I'm tired.
You can do this for me, huh, Cap? And I'll bring you back a nice mess of catfish.
I'll see you in a couple of weeks.
Where the hell have you been?
You know the pier at Bethlehem Steel?
Yeah. I worked it four years ago with Mike.
You know, my dad trusts you. That's not like him.
Why not? I'm one of the beautiful people.
I send my extras over to Turkey for harem duty.
I really don't have time for your confessions right now.
I don't want this to sound too harsh, but to tell you the truth, I really don't give a shit.
Call Ben and Donnie. Tell them to meet me here a halfhour before dawn.
OK. Soon as we get all secure.
I need an extra man to stay with the boat.
I don't care if he runs for president and winds up in Arlington.
Miller, you stay out here up high.
Yeah. All right, the rest of us inside. Move it.
Let's go. You stay with the boat.
Take it down easy. Now load it.
All right, come on. Come on. Let's go. Let's go.
Go to the back, there's a staircase. Go upstairs, put the light on. We'll wait here.
Hey, this is a mousetrap, Mike.
He'll be here. I know him. I can just feel it.
Is that why you made 'em put the lights on upstairs? He blew you apart, didn't he?
Whatever he does dictates the way you go.
You're gettin' to be his prisoner, Mike. Up here.
I've never had it more together in my life.
You know what makes me laugh?
Since five o'clock you've been gettin' shot at, stabbed at, yelled at.
You broke enough local ordinances to put yourself on ice for 100 years.
And how many dead people so far?
Oh, yeah. I know the rationale.
Well... this one does have a little fringe benefit.
You're so busy doin' your dirty work you can't tell who the bad guys are.
I know who the bad guys are.
Anybody that tries to hurt me.
They're all tryin' to hurt you, Mike.
All the wheelers and dealers at the top with their gin and fizzes.
They need you to do their bloodletting while they make speeches about freedom.
There's not one power system that really cares about its civilians.
Would you take a little air?
Set one of those automatics at the back door.
Now check the back, all right?
You take the boat, check out the ketch.
What the hell are you doin'?
Going out to use the night.
I got a maniac out there with a .3006.
He'll blow you apart if you take ten steps.
He'll have to see me first.
Look, do me a favour. Go over there and do the tiger claw and the crane stance and the chicken wing and all that other crap in the corner.
Can you talk to her, please?
What kinda whackedout family is this?
Jerome! Don't shoot! It's that whackedout chick in a wet suit!
Well, get your finger off the trigger!
Now Hansen knows exactly where we are.
You people don't care if you live or die.
Of course we do. It's in the manner of living and dying one finds relevance.
Ah. That's how you're gonna do it? You're gonna go back to your country to die.
Who's gonna keep you alive there?
Wait a minute. I understand it now.
He wants to go back to die on his own native soil.
Every country, if it hopes to become a democracy, needs at least one voice raised in opposition. I happen to be selected.
Let just one other person hear my voice, that is a beginning. It's enough.
Huh. Huh. I'll give you this.
The other sheep I've dipped have always been running away from their countries.
You're the first one to jump back into the frying pan.
That's what I was tellin' you. You're risking your life keepin' him alive and gettin' him back some place where they're gonna finish him off anyway.
Why did you have to drag your daughter along? Shouldn't she be in a convent?
For the same reason, Mr. Locken, you are not able to keep her from going outside.
Mac, do me a favour. Run a check on the back again, will ya?
I'm very glad that I'm not your insurance broker.
I am? You'd better check your goddamn policy. And pick up a weapon.
Cos that philosophical bullshit won't get you on that ship!
Now pick up a goddamn weapon!
Tell her father to come out.
And you and Mac and Miller go out into the light.
Otherwise she takes three straight into her inscrutable smile.
Did you go through her purse yet?
Not yet. I haven't had time.
I thought, for the right price, you always had the time.
You're right, man. I got the right price. Like me to cut you in?
Don't be stupid. Who are you loyal to?
Your boss? We both have the same boss.
What do you mean, what do I mean?
We both work for the same guy.
Don't feel bad. I got the highest buyout figure any one of us ever got.
Well, this one is Bora Bora. For the next five years.
The good life in the sun.
Well, why didn't you kill me?
If not me, it would've been someone else.
He happens to have a gun at your head.
You wouldn't shoot an You bet I would.
Can you believe this, George? It's lovely, isn't it?
It's all I gotta hear now is a little Chinese soap opera.
Notched every one of these little .385 myself, you know.
Be quite a scene now if we all started shootin', wouldn't it?
Mike, I've got nothing against this girl, and I'm dead set against killing you.
It's the Chinaman I want. It's his problem.
I'll see if I can't hustle Collie into boosting my fee. Give you a nice piece of it.
But, Mike... if you don't work this out with me, we're both screwed.
Collie has a mixed bag of killers backing me up.
For all I know he's sent them after both of us.
Win a few, lose a few.
Now, stay right where you are. Put your pistol down.
All right. Put your cane down.
I hear you've gotten pretty good with it.
Let's go back in and get comfortable.
The optimum would've been a confession from Collie.
With Hansen dead, we have no witness, but it's a step in the right direction.
I don't give a damn about that. That's your department.
I just wanna know what to do. I'm sure not followin' up Collie' rendezvous plan.
He'll find out Hansen blew it and send that pack down before I get Chung out to sea.
Tomorrow morning, get over to Suisun Bay where the Mothball Fleet is anchored.
